section.name: Intro
section.p: This document describes the configuration file used by mod_jk2 on the Tomcat site. Its default name is ${jkHome}/conf/jk2.properties, where ${jkHome} is the well known ${catalina.base} property.

tr.td: Define the class of the handler myhandler.
Location of the jkjni dynamic library. It is searched in java.library.path but a absolut path can be specified.
A communication transport from a remote Web Server.
First port where Tomcat is listening
Local address where Tomcat is listening.
A AF_UNIX socket communication transport from a local Web Server.
Name of the "file" associate with the socket. That must be absolut path name.

Unix socket where tomcat is listening.

section.name: Examples
section.p: The examples below are working when the Web Server is configured according the examples described in the configweb file.

subsection.name: using normal socket
subsection.p: There is no need to use the jkjni logic to use normal socket, so that just for Fun.

p.source:
# list of needed handlers. handler.list=apr,channelSocket,request
# Override the default port for the channelSocket channelSocket.port=8019
# Dynamic library apr.NativeSo=/home1/jakarta/jakarta-tomcat-connectors/jk/build/jk2/apache2/jkjni.so

subsection.name: using AF_UNIX socket
subsection.p: Create and listen on a AF_UNIX socket. The location of the socket must be the same in the Web Server configuration file.

p.source:
# list of needed handlers. handler.list=apr,channelUnix,request
# Location of the socket. channelUnix.file=${jkHome}/work/jk2.socket
# Dynamic library jtc=/home1/jakarta/jakarta-tomcat-connectors apr.NativeSo=${jtc}/jk/build/jk2/apache2/jkjni.so

subsection.name: using user defined class for communication
subsection.p: It is possible to have a user defined class for the communication. Here we have used the ChannelUn as example.

p.source:
# Define our own handler. class.mychannel=org.apache.jk.common.ChannelUn # list of needed handlers. handler.list=apr,mychannel,request
# Location of the socket. channelUnix.file=${jkHome}/work/jk2.socket
# Dynamic library jtc=/home1/jakarta/jakarta-tomcat-connectors apr.NativeSo=${jtc}/jk/build/jk2/apache2/jkjni.so
